sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Handwritten draft letter fragment from Schenker to Hugo Friedmann, dated March 14, 1917
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: Final page only, in which Schenker reserves further decisions regarding his legacies from Sofie Deutsch's will.
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: Nichtvergebung; non-issuing; Uebereinstimmung; agreement; Anschauung; outlook; Entschluß; decision

tei:div.tei:note: The earlier pages of this letter are missing.
tei:div.tei:p: ...Because of the fragmentary nature of the document, the meaning of its content is not entirely clear. We can only hope that the earlier pages will come to light eventually. einen Stelle „noch will ich nicht das letzte Wort gesprochen haben“Clause used by Schenker in the seventh paragraph of his letter to Friedmann OC 1B/19–20, March 12, 1917. an der anderen, u. schließlich verstand ich unter NichtvergebungThe normal meaning of “Nichtvergebung” is “non-forgiveness.” Reference is to the “stipends for impecunious skilled composers and composition pupils” instituted by Sofie Deutsch, which were to be placed entirely at Schenker’s discretion, about which Schenker expressed misgivings in his previous letter to Friedmann. des Stipendiums an der gleich darauffolgenden Stelle nur die fallsweise, sowie sie schon auch die Erblasserin in Uebereinstimmung mit meinen Anschauungen ins Auge gefasst hat. Ich behalte mir somit nach meinen Erfahrungen die weiteren Entschlüsse vor. Für all Ihre übrigen Mitteilungen besten Dank.

tei:div.tei:note: The earlier pages of this letter are missing.
tei:div.tei:p: ... the one passage “This is not, however, my last word on the subject.” to the other, and I at last understood by the non-awarding of the stipend at the passage immediately thereafter, but only on an ad hoc basis, as well as it has envisaged also the deceased to be in agreement with my outlook. In view of my experiences, I accordingly reserve my further decisions. Many thanks for all your other communications.
